parse.title: Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem

{{disambig-more|Beowulf|[[Beowulf (disambiguation)]]}}
{{book
| title=<small>Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem with a Discussion of the Stories of Offa and Finn</small>

'''''Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem with a Discussion of the Stories of Offa and Finn''''' is a 1921 book by [[R.W. Chambers]] about ''[[Beowulf (poem)|Beowulf]]''.

By [[28 July]] [[1922]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] had agreed to review this book for G.N. Clark, editor of the ''English Historical Review''. He made [[Index:Unpublished material|several pages of notes]], but would not complete the review (or perhaps it was never published).<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Christina Scull]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]]|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=14 April 2014}}</ref>

On [[24 May]] [[1932]], Chambers sent Tolkien an inscribed copy of the second edition of ''Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem'' (published the same month).<ref>*[[Douglas A. Anderson]], "R.W. Chambers and ''The Hobbit''", in {{TS|3}}, p. 141</ref>
